---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [45f718bf46](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20231/commits/45f718bf462c6336f5932494227629623237c831)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Data.FP.Basic | 512 | 416 | -96 (-18.75%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.FP.Basic`|-96|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (4.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4837|-4|porting notes|

Current commit [45f718bf46](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/45f718bf462c6336f5932494227629623237c831)
Reference commit [3874e58afc](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/3874e58afcc4bec5aa413c32624f2b7c5c2628e3)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4ca1858f-dfab-4f11-9281-3dc98e9f74b1) for commit 45f718bf462c6336f5932494227629623237c831.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/bc03d2b4-e312-4680-8ec5-4dd73c183b98/to/4ca1858f-dfab-4f11-9281-3dc98e9f74b1) against commit 3874e58afcc4bec5aa413c32624f2b7c5c2628e3.
Taking a step back: thanks for proposing these golfs! They are much nicer to read, and mostly quite a bit faster.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12501077530/job/34878067472)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12501077530/job/34878067620)

Let me label a few places that got slightly slower (found by sorting the benchmarking output by the "absolute change" column). Probably, most of these are still worth it - but this should be a conscious decision.

The total build instructions only increases by 0.006%, which amounts to 1038*.006%~0.06 seconds wall-clock time, so I wouldn't worry about the slowdown. Thanks!
maintainer merge

Let me label a few places that got slightly slower (found by sorting the benchmarking output by the "absolute change" column). Probably, most of these are still worth it - but this should be a conscious decision.

The total build instructions only increases by 0.006%, which amounts to 1038*.006%~0.06 seconds wall-clock time, so I wouldn't worry about the slowdown. Thanks!
maintainer merge
This file got a bit slower.
This also got a bit slower.
As did this file (not sure which line).
This file got about 5% slower (but this is a nice golf, so perhaps worth it).
This file also got a bit slower.
Also very slightly slower - but the automation is probably worth it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(*): golf using `omega`

The total build instructions only increases by 0.006%, which amounts to 1038*.006%~0.06 seconds wall-clock time, so I wouldn't worry about the slowdown. Thanks!
